alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:17PM EST until further notice by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. For the Rockaway River...including Boonton Below Resvr...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River at Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. At 7.7 feet, Change Bridge Road in Montville, north of Woodmont Road and south of Stiles Lane, floods. River Road in Montville floods near Condurso`s Garden Center. Both roads are closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Thursday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river level is expected to fall tonight and Friday but remain above flood stage. More rains Friday night will cause the level to rise again this weekend. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.8 feet on 04/17/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 6.1 Thu 7 pm 5.3 6.7 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 830 AM EST.
